thread.title: Flavor Flav gets February trial date in misdemeanour Las Vegas DUI, speeding, cocaine case
thread.title_full: Flavor Flav gets February trial date in misdemeanour Las Vegas DUI, speeding, cocaine case

title: Flavor Flav gets February trial date in misdemeanour Las Vegas DUI, speeding, cocaine case
text:
The Canadian Press - ONLINE EDITION Flavor Flav gets February trial date in misdemeanour Las Vegas DUI, speeding, cocaine case By: The Associated Press Enlarge Image 
Entertainer Flavor Flav, left, standing with attorney Todd Greenberg, speaks with reporters after pleading guilty to one count of aggravated unlicensed operation of a motor vehicle, Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, in Mineola, N.Y. Flav, whose real name is William Drayton, Jr., was arrested in January, 2014 while racing to his mother's funeral on Long Island. A judge in Nassau Criminal Court on Tuesday sentenced Flav to time served, essentially the time he was in custody following the arrest. He was fined $3,600. (AP Photo/Frank Eltman) 
LAS VEGAS, Nev. - Trial has been postponed to Feb. 8 for entertainer Flavor Flav on misdemeanour driving under the influence, speeding and cocaine charges stemming from a vehicle stop last May in Las Vegas. 
Prosecutors and defence attorney Dayvid Figler said the new date allows time to try to resolve the case against the 56-year-old rapper and reality television star whose name is William Drayton Jr. 
The Nevada Highway Patrol says the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductee was clocked going 87 mph in a 65 mph zone. 
Drayton settled criminal charges this week in New York's Nassau County stemming from a traffic stop while racing to his mother's funeral on Long Island. 
He pleaded guilty Tuesday to an unlicensed driver charge, was fined about $3,600 and sentenced to time already served.
